author: Mike Kerrigan
title: A Centerfold and a Lesson From Mom
text:
St. Augustine has always been my favorite saint. How can you not be drawn to someone who, in his wayward youth, prayed, “Lord, make me chaste, but not yet”?
Or how about Augustine’s mother, St. Monica, who never gave up on her once-rebellious “son of so many tears”? I can relate—not to the saintliness of the son, but to the steadfastness of the mother.
One...
